alert.note: Alert for Baldwin; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 5:13AM EDT until April 08 at 9:48AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Milledgeville affecting Washington, Wilkinson and Baldwin Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Big Sandy Creek at US 441 near Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Oconee River near Milledgeville. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Between 27 and 30 feet, Minor flooding continues in the woodlands and pasture upstream and downstream from the gage located around one half mile upstream from the Georgia Highway 22 and 24 bridge. The parking lot and the Oconee River Greenway Park just downstream from the bridge will be completely flooded with water several feet deep. Sinclair Dam will have three to four gates open to reach this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 28.4 feet and rising. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM EDT Wednesday was 28.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 28.1 feet and then begin rising this morning. It will then rise again to 29.5 feet this evening. It will fall to 29.4 feet and then begin rising tomorrow morning. It will then rise again to 29.6 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will fall below flood stage early Friday morning to 12.0 feet and then begin rising early Sunday morning then rise again. - Flood stage is 22 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 30.6 feet on 03/16/1976. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
